metadata.Title: CVE-2019-6778 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
In QEMU 3.0.0, tcp_emu in slirp/tcp_subr.c has a heap-based bufferoverflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-6778` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
qemu-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
qemu-system - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
qemu-system-ppc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
qemu-system-sparc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
qemu-system-x86 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
qemu-user - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
qemu-user-static - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
qemu-utils - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.45').
